Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2016 IEEE Global Communications Conference (IEEE GLOBECOM)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division Of Computer and Network Systems

Award.AbstractNarration:
This travel grant will be used to support US based graduate students to attend IEEE GLOBECOM 2016, to be held in Washington, DC on December 4-8, 2016. IEEE GLOBECOM is one of two flagship conferences of the IEEE Communications Society (ComSoc). This conference offers not only technical paper presentations but also a wide range of other educational formats, including panels, tutorials, industry presentations, posters and keynote speeches by academic and industry leaders. Attending IEEE GLOBECOM is highly valuable for students. Not only will they be exposed to the state-of-the-art researches in the field of communications and networking, but also they can have the opportunity to interact with peers from institutions worldwide, meet with leading researchers from both industry and academia, and take part in discussions that may shape the future of the field.

This grant encourages participation by students who would normally find it difficult to attend. Recipients of the travel awards will be selected by a Travel Grants Committee, formed by the IEEE GLOBECOM 2016 student travel grant co-chairs. A total of 25 awardees will be selected. Award selection criteria include papers accepted into the conference and research interests in the conference topics as demonstrated by coursework and/or project experience. Women and minorities are given preference when other qualifications are similar. To avoid conflicts of interest, the students of the faculty in the selection committee will not be considered for this travel grant award. This student travel support will enable sharing scientific information and stimulating research interests for U.S. based students in the field of communications and networking.

POR.DRECONTENT:
National Science Foundation (NSF) has been generously supporting Student Travel Grants for IEEE GLOBECOM, thus playing an instrumental role in establishing this widely successful program. NSF student travel grant has significantly boosted the participation of US-based undergraduate/graduate students in GLOBECOM. Each awardee is provided up to $1000 to reimburse the travel cost, with a breakdown of registration fee, flight and local transportation, hotel, and miscellaneous expenses.

To ensure an equal opportunity for all interested individuals to apply for the travel funds, the program was advertised in several ways, including an announcement on the IEEE GLOBECOM 2016 web page and announcements on major mailing lists in related IEEE societies. All travel grant applications were submitted electronically through EDAS including the documents: resume (with ethnicity and gender information optional to broaden the participation of under-represented students), a statement letter from the student, and a recommendation letter from the student’s advisor.

The two travel grant co-chairs formed a committee to select the awardees. The selection was based on balanced consideration of multiple factors including paper scores/quality, application documents, women/minority priority, and distribution over different universities. 47 applications from US students were received, and 25 students from 25 universities were awarded. All the awardees attended the conference and there travel costs were reimbursed (up to $1000) from this travel grant after the conference.

With the NSF student travel grant, some outstanding students who cannot receive fund support from their research institutes will be financially capable to participate GLOBECOM. Attending such a high-caliber technical venue is very valuable for students. Not only will they be exposed to the state-of-the-art researches in the field of communications and networking, but also they can have the opportunity to interact with peers from institutions worldwide, meet with leading researchers from both industry and academia, and take part in discussions that may shape the future of the field (in terms of technology, standards, services, etc). For graduating senior students to be on the job market, attending GLOBECOM may significantly benefit their career development. Through communications with people, students can collect job information, introduce their research and demonstrate their capabilities to potential employers, and get knowing people who can serve as references for their job applications.
